definition: to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: You have the nerve to call that fine?
sentences.chinese: 你为这个叫好，你神经错乱啊？

sentences.english: We oohed and aahed over our handiwork as the presents were exchanged.
sentences.chinese: 在交换礼物时为对方亲手做的小礼品不停地欢呼叫好。

sentences.english: We applauded and cheered for a goal scored by our own team.
sentences.chinese: 我们为自己的队踢进一球拍手叫好。

sentences.english: He sings terribly, out of tune now and then, but I still have to applaud.
sentences.chinese: 他唱得真不怎么样，经常走调，不过我还得鼓掌叫好。

sentences.english: Whenever the Chinese made a mistake, the Americans cheered, which angered me greatly.
sentences.chinese: 每当中国人一出错，美国人就叫好，这使我很生气。

sentences.english: Experts have celebrated the power of brainstorming and idea-generation techniques.
sentences.chinese: 专家们为脑力激荡和创意产生机制的威力拍手叫好。

sentences.english: Ali's recitation was so good that she gave three encores .
sentences.chinese: 阿丽的朗诵是那么好，她给三次叫好。

sentences.english: For all those reasons, Gates should be applauded for his candor.
sentences.chinese: 出于所有这些原因，盖茨应该为他的坦率拍手叫好。

sentences.english: Luckily her mother Kelly was waiting outside with a cab ready to go.
sentences.chinese: 幸好她母亲叫好出租车等在外面随时准备出发。

sentences.english: All the audience applaud to their excellent performance.
sentences.chinese: 所有的观众对他们的精彩演出拍手叫好。

sentences.english: But if you dance, we will think well of you for trying.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果你跳了，我们会为你的尝试而叫好。

sentences.english: Ice consents the shrine, MaXiaoHu ecstasy shout loudly, the young also clap.
sentences.chinese: 冰儿含羞答允，马小虎狂喜大叫，众少年也拍手叫好。

sentences.english: Give the screenplay a shout out if it inspires you.
sentences.chinese: 为那些能给你启发的剧本大声叫好。

sentences.english: Wave after wave of cheers and applauses filled up my ears while tears welled out of my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 在一浪高过一浪的叫好声中，我的眼里泪水汹涌。

sentences.english: Then, somebody clap applauds , somebody hate sb's guts.
sentences.chinese: 于是，有人拍手叫好，有人恨之入骨。

definition: to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance
to complain of an injustice/to lament sb's misfortune
adverse audience reaction: boos and jeers, hissing, catcalls or deliberate applause after a mistake
to praise/to speak highly of/to commend
variant of 嘩然|哗然[hua2 ran2]
in uproar/commotion/causing a storm of protest/tumultuous
to agree/to go along with/to echo (what sb says)
